rules: Rule1: Provided that Al Capone produces alcohol, he profits.
Rule2: Under the condition that Al Capone is wealthy, if it is not the case that whenever he manufactures alcohol, he either sells alcohol or produces alcohol, then he is not arrested.
Rule3: If Al Capone violates the Volstead Act, then he is not acquitted.
Rule4: Under the condition that Al Capone is a gangster, he is influential.
Rule5: Provided that Al Capone is powerful, if it is not the case that violating the Volstead Act results in his acquittal, then he is not convicted.
Rule6: Whenever Al Capone imports alcohol, he either sells alcohol or produces alcohol.
Rule7: Al Capone imports alcohol or he manufactures alcohol.
Rule8: Al Capone transports alcohol, or he distributes alcohol, or, if it is not the case that manufacturing alcohol implies he either sells alcohol or produces alcohol, then he is not arrested.
Rule9: Provided that Al Capone bribes an officer, he distributes alcohol.
Rule10: Al Capone bribes an officer or he evades the law.
Rule11: If Al Capone evades the law, then he is wealthy.
Rule12: If it is not the case that violating the Volstead Act leads to his acquittal, then Al Capone is convicted.
Rule13: If it is not the case that being influential implies he is powerful, then Al Capone is imprisoned.
Rule14: Under the condition that it is not true that being influential entails he is powerful, Al Capone is not imprisoned.
Rule15: Whenever it is not the case that manufacturing alcohol implies he either sells alcohol or produces alcohol, Al Capone is arrested.
Rule16: Provided that it is not the case that not producing alcohol leads to him not being legitimate, Al Capone violates the Volstead Act.
Rule17: If Al Capone does not produce alcohol, then he is legitimate.
facts: Fact1: Al Capone is a gangster.
Fact2: Al Capone does not sell alcohol.
Fact3: Al Capone does not distribute alcohol.
Fact4: Al Capone does not transport alcohol.
